tweets.text: Happy #LancashireDay. 2 little tempters of the marvellousness that me & the team at @EnvAgencyNW are lucky to serve. #coast #rivers #people https://t.co/llzkc7Hlry

We're demolishing Shade Chapel this weekend to reduce flood risk to Todmorden.

Part of Rochdale Rd & Knowlwood Rd will be closed from 8pm tonight until 6am on Monday so we can do this safely. Diversions will be in place. Please keep away from the site
https://t.co/kp3y70FTFJ https://t.co/blFAicAXTh

Part of Rochdale Road will be closed to traffic & pedestrians from 8pm Fri 27 until 6am Mon 30 Nov to demolish Shade Chapel safely & reduce the risk of #flooding. 

There will be a diversion via Littleborough, Sowerby Bridge, Mytholmroyd, Hebbden Bridge 

https://t.co/j8x6wTIfoD https://t.co/akX7nRyy7l

tweets.text:
Part of Rochdale Road and Knowlwood Road will be closed from 8pm tonight until 6am on Monday so that @EnvAgencyYNE can carry out essential work, demolishing Shade Chapel to reduce flood risk to Todmorden.

Please plan your journey in advance as delays are likely. https://t.co/dvRizaZGLx

It is spawning time for #salmon on many of our rivers here in @EnvAgencyMids You may see very sick looking salmon after spawning these are known as #kelts 
These salmon are still protected & must not be removed, they will die & decompose which contributes food to river ecosystems https://t.co/Fh69g3FKiG

21 containers of illegally exported waste sent to Sri Lanka have successfully returned to England.

urls.description: Developing the Natural AIre is returning Atlantic salmon to the River AIre with fish passes in Leeds and Saltaire supported by volunteers.

tweets.text:
We are excited to announce that the fish and eel pass at Saltaire has been finished.

 We are now a major step closer to returning Salmon to the river Aire for the first time in 150 years. https://t.co/kUqW6LwbQO

#DNAire #AireRiversTrust #EnvironmentAgency #Riverrestoration https://t.co/AQ2gaooeMg

tweets.text: Thankfully Blaydon Quarry LFS not gaining permission to avoid another 90k tonnes per annum of active landfill tax üòú https://t.co/aUCmBar5Ly

@LDNWaterkeeper @EnvAgencySE @tommustill @WestReservoir @WildWoodberry Is the algae not related to the extortionate background pollution (nitrates & phosphates)? If so #tellthetruth Nothing ‚Äúnatural‚Äù about this #fishkill event #HealthyRivers #SDG6 #SDG14 #StateOfNature @DefraWater

The majority of Earth's chalk streams & rivers are found in England; fragile, extraordinary ecologies.
But they're dying from water company over-extraction, pollution & @EnvAgency inaction.
@Feargal_Sharkey is leading an event (8 Dec) on stopping the rot.
https://t.co/znRcXVS58x

We‚Äôre delighted that defence schemes in Thatcham that will protect around 600 homes from the risk of surface water flooding are now complete. It‚Äôs a great example of partnership working with @ThatchamFF and the @EnvAgency. Read more here: https://t.co/fvudVOgeW1 https://t.co/6HvdjLUFDR

@RoryCopus @EnvAgency 1/2 Hi Rory, The fault at Sutton Courtenay gauging station is being addressed as part of a major asset infrastructure project, it involves a complex diving operation to lay a new cross-river cable which includes a full replacement of the instrumentation. To complete this...

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE I thought I would try and find the gauge station myself, to see how hard it actually was. Turns out, pretty easy üíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I‚Äôve included a photo of the map reference, to help you guys find it too, so that you can fix it. Ref # 1852967 (2/2) https://t.co/Q7k0mph3H6
@EnvAgencySE @tommustill @WestReservoir @WildWoodberry Thanks for the update Peter. It seems the algae is an ongoing problem?
